text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atari 8-bit family is a line of computers launched by Atari in 1979. Based on the MOS Technology 6502 CPU clocked at 1.79MHz, Atari revolutionized the PC marketplace by adding a co-processor to handle more intense tasks. This allowed its video output to reach up to 384 pixels per line in 256 colors and 4-way sound. It would compete against the Apple ][, the Commodore PET and the TRS-80. The first two models, the 400 and 800, had the minimum 16 and 48KB of user-expandable RAM installed, while the later XL and XE models would have the maximum 64 and 128KB installed.
